verbs.description: repurpose (third-person singular simple present repurposes, present participle repurposing, simple past and past participle repurposed)

entries.meaning: To reuse for a different purpose, on a long-term basis, without alteration.
examples: The town common was repurposed as a practice field.

entries.meaning: To alter to make more suited for a different purpose.
examples: The church was repurposed as a nightclub by lighting changes and removing the pews, but it never opened.
